symc.name: SW_HIDE
symc.desc: Hides the window and activates another window.

symc.name: SW_MINIMIZE
symc.desc: Minimizes the specified window and activates the next top-level window in the z-order.

symc.name: SW_RESTORE
symc.desc: Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, Windows restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when restoring a minimized window.

symc.name: SW_SHOW
symc.desc: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

symc.name: SW_SHOWDEFAULT
symc.desc: Sets the show state based on the SW_ flag specified in the STARTUPINFO structure passed to the CreateProcess function by the program that started the application. An application should call ShowWindow with this flag to set the initial show state of its main window.

symc.name: SW_SHOWMINIMIZED
symc.desc: Activates the window and displays it as a minimized window

symc.name: SW_SHOWMINNOACTIVE
symc.desc: Displays the window as a minimized window. The active window remains active

symc.name: SW_SHOWNA
symc.desc: Displays the window in its current state. The active window remains active

symc.name: SW_SHOWNOACTIVATE
symc.desc: Displays a window in its most recent size and position. The active window remains active.

symc.name: SW_SHOWNORMAL
symc.desc: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, Windows restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.
